meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a loud, heavy sound.
meanings.sent1: He whoomps the drum with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The hammer whoomps against the metal, creating sparks.
meanings.sent3: The clown whoomps the balloon, making it burst with a bang.
meanings.sent4: The storm whoomps the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler whoomps his opponent to the ground in victory.

meanings.definition: A loud, heavy sound made by something striking or hitting.
meanings.sent1: The whoomps of the falling tree echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The whoomps of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The whoomps of the falling rain on the roof lulled me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The whoomps of the thunder shook the windows in their frames.
meanings.sent5: The whoomps of the crashing waves against the shore were deafening.
